docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile -- The importance of Salvador Allende Gossens, Chile's new Marxist President, is that he is trying to introduce an entirely novel aspect to the idea of revolution. "The revolution in the revolution" that he sponsors could prove far...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile -- The importance of Salvador Allende Gossens, Chile's new Marxist President, is that he is trying to introduce an entirely novel aspect to the idea of revolution. "The revolution in the revolution" that he sponsors could prove far more significant than the violent processes advocated in a book bearing that title by the young French intellectual friend of Castro and Guevara, Regis Debray.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 31 (AP) -- A confidant of President Jorge Pacheco Areco was kidnapped by Tupamaro guerrillas for the second time within three years as he sat in a dentist's chair yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 31 (AP) -- A confidant of President Jorge Pacheco Areco was kidnapped by Tupamaro guerrillas for the second time within three years as he sat in a dentist's chair yesterday.
docs.abstract: U Pereira Reverbel, Pres Pacheco's confidant and dir of state-owned telephone co, kidnapped by Tupamaros for 2d time in 3 yrs, while sitting in dentist's chair, Montevideo; pulls gun out is beaten unconscious and taken down bldg bundled in blanket; was held by Tupamaros 5 days in '68

headline.main: REBELS IN URUGUAY KIDNAP AIDE AGAIN

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 26 -- Experts believe that Uruguay's Tupamaro guerrillas are using tunnels under the city of Montevideo for communications and spying, hideouts for men and materiel and jails for hostages.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 26 -- Experts believe that Uruguay's Tupamaro guerrillas are using tunnels under the city of Montevideo for communications and spying, hideouts for men and materiel and jails for hostages.
docs.abstract: accts by Atty Gen Berro, recently freed by Tupamaros after being held for 13 days, strongly suggest Tupamaros are using tunnels under Montevideo for communications and spying hideouts and jails for hostages; Berro repts he talked to hostage Amb Jackson who, he repts, spends most of time naked or wearing shorts because of intense heat; says all prisoners are kept blindfolded at all times except when confined in cells, are drugged and kept unconscious in some cases; describes Jackson's jail as 'deep cellar with noisy ventilators'; Tupamaros have largely ignored countryside, announcing they will use Montevideo streets and houses in same way Natl Liberation Front has used jungles and countryside of Vietnam; UTE, Govt agency administering elec power and all communications, believed to be infiltrated; Berro kidnapping by Tupamaros dressed in uniforms of UTE telephone repairmen cited

headline.main: URUGUAYAN TELLS OF REBELS' PRISON; Hostage Suggests Tunnels Under City Were Used

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO -- When French President de Gaulle visited Brazil a few years ago he asked the then military dictator, General Castelo Branco, just what a Latin-American military dictator was. Castelo Branco replied: "A man, not necessarily a general,...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO -- When French President de Gaulle visited Brazil a few years ago he asked the then military dictator, General Castelo Branco, just what a Latin-American military dictator was. Castelo Branco replied: "A man, not necessarily a general, who finds it pleasant to get power and extremely unpleasant to leave it."
docs.abstract: C L Sulzberger comment on continuing dictatorship in Brazil voices fears that nation, like most of Latin Amer, is on brink of unknown with little chance of durable kind of real democracy

docs.snippet: PRINCETON, N.J., April 17 -- More than 60 scientists from 16 nations will meet at Princeton University next week to discuss means of obtaining the most scientific information from a global atmospheric observing system that is scheduled for completion...
docs.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J., April 17 -- More than 60 scientists from 16 nations will meet at Princeton University next week to discuss means of obtaining the most scientific information from a global atmospheric observing system that is scheduled for completion in 1976.
docs.abstract: Scientists from 16 nations to conf soon, Princeton Univ, on means of obtaining most scientific information from a global atmospheric observing system, an internatl project started in '61 and scheduled for completion in '76; project is 1st attempt ever made to monitor entire atmosphere of earth; participating nations listed

headline.main: PRINCETON PARLEY ON WEATHER IS SET
